name: PENÁĆ SENĆOŦEN
description: A unicase (all-uppercase) Latin script developed by PENÁĆ Dave Elliott Sr., a language keeper who brought together elders in the 1970s and developed a typewriter-friendly script with over-stroke diacritics.

name: Expanded Academic SENĆOŦEN
description: An expanded version of PENÁĆ Dave Elliott Sr.'s script from academic linguist Timothy Montler, distinguished by its use of the cedilla (¸) to denote glottal stops and a set of tightly-voiced consonants not otherwise identified in vernacular use.

name: Americanist Sənčéθən
description: An academic usage of Americanist phonetic notation, which is itself adapted somewhat from IPA, to transcribe SENĆOŦEN prior to the development and widespread use of PENÁĆ's alphabet.
